metadata.title: CVE-2019-14498 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A divide-by-zero error exists in the Control function of demux/caf.c in VideoLAN VLC media player 3.0.7.1. As a result, an FPE can be triggered via a crafted CAF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-14498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.8-2
libvlc5 - 3.0.8-2
libvlccore9 - 3.0.8-2
vlc - 3.0.8-2
vlc-bin - 3.0.8-2
vlc-data - 3.0.8-2
vlc-l10n - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.8-2
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.8-2
No subscription required

advisory.discovered_by: Antonio Morales from the Semmle Security Team

criterions.comment: vlc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-2').
